FuncDef:
The macsec dot1q-in-clear command enables the MACsec Dot1q VLAN tag in the clear function.
The undo macsec dot1q-in-clear command disables the MACsec Dot1q VLAN tag in the clear function.
The macsec qinq-in-clear command enables the MACsec QinQ VLAN tag in the clear function.
The undo macsec qinq-in-clear command disables the MACsec QinQ VLAN tag in the clear function.
By default, the MACsec VLAN tag in the clear function is not enabled.
ParentView: EVC view of an Ethernet interface
EVC view of a GE interface

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates dot1q VLAN tag in the clear.
-

Indicates QinQ VLAN tag in the clear.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The MACsec VLAN tag in the clear function allows MACsec not to encrypt VLAN tags. The hub site router uses a Layer 3 (IP) sub-interface of each VLAN that is associated with each remote site branch. The result is a highly flexible MACsec hub/spoke design that eliminates the older solutions that require a physical interface "per remote site" on the hub router. By default, MACsec encrypts VLAN tags in the original packets. To enable the MACsec VLAN tag in the clear function, run the macsec { dot1q-in-clear | qinq-in-clear } command.
Prerequisites
CKN and CAK have been configured using the mka cak-mode static ckn cak { simple | cipher } command.
